content.description:
PROPOSED CUTS BY PRESIDENT VERSUS THE BUDGET PASSED BY CONGRESS

Percent Change in 2018 Funding from Enacting 2017 Funding, By Department or Agency

Source: Congressional Budget Office; Office of Management and Budget, 2018
content.question: Which of the following is an accurate conclusion based on the data illustrated in the bar chart?

choices.label: Presidents are able to use the power of the bully pulpit to pressure Congress to address their priorities.
The presidentâ€™s advisers are more concerned about an economic recession than are members of Congress.
Despite the increased power of the president, the budget authority is still a major feature of congressional power.
Presidential efforts to increase spending will result in increased authorizations without any action from members of Congress.

content.answer: Despite the increased power of the president, the budget authority is still a major feature of congressional power.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
